You’ll be hard-pressed to meet someone who hasn’t at least walked through an Ulta or perused the store’s website. Its shelves (both brick-and-mortar and digital) are that perfect mix of drugstore and designer brands, with more sales than we can keep up with. And then there are the unfairly overlooked brands, most of which are also some of the best K-beauty products Ulta has to offer. We need to do better people! In all seriousness, a Korean Beauty lineup will have your skin looking like a Glossier ad and completely elevate your knowledge of unconventional, but totally effective ingredients like snail mucin and donkey milk. My favorite part of shopping exclusively K-beauty is knowing that I’ll probably save a lot of money because rarely is there a moisturizer or face mask that costs more than a cheap lunch. Related Stories TikTok Is Hooked on This $18 Cleansing Oil That Removes Blackheads on the Spot This Viral Snail Mucin Essence Helped Fade a TikToker’s Acne Scars—Snag It on Sale For $14 Next time you’re in Ulta, I implore you to sample some of these skincare favorites. It’s guaranteed that you’ll buy at least one. Our mission at STYLECASTER is to bring style to the people, and we only feature products we think you’ll love as much as we do. Please note that if you purchase something by clicking on a link within this story, we may receive a small commission of the sale. Snail mucin sounds kind-of gross, but it’s actual a powerhouse ingredient for hydrating and brightening the skin. This essence, meant to be used in between your cleanser and moisturizer is 96% snail mucin. Wear this moisturizer, infused with licorice root extract, under your makeup to get a subtle highlight that’ll have everyone asking what filter you used in your selfies.   As it turns out, a killer combo of hyaluronic acid and algae extract is the key to “glass” skin. Paint on, take a selfie, and peel off this charcoal-infused mask to remove every single bit of makeup and oil off your T-zone. Pamper your lips while you sleep and apply this ultra-hydrating treatment before shutting off the lights. (Pro-tip: you can also wear it as a balm during the day.) A trifecta of fruit acids (watermelon, pink grapefruit, blood orange) exfoliate the skin so dead, dry layers fall off, leaving you with smooth, moisturized heels.  This all-in-one super juice serum does everything from even out tone to calm redness to gradually improving texture. A crazy lightweight cleanser that uses egg extract to suck up excess oil and leave you with a complexion that looks nearly poreless. In addition to two types of egg extract this moisturizer is also infused with collagen fiber to perk up skin that’s lost some elasticity. Shiso leaf is an antioxidant with next-level ability to protect the skin against pollution. Seven days after use, the vegetable-based formula will slowly remove keratin from the feet.
